### `0.1 Set Up` 

I will use the following packages: 

* `dplyr` to manipulate the data.

* `lubridate` to convert 

```{r, echo=F, message=F}
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(kableExtra) 
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(plotly)
```

### `0.2 Collect Data` 

To build this data from scratch, I started with 13 different popular ballets. 

```{r}
Ballet <- c("Swan Lake", 
            "The Nutcracker", 
            "Giselle", 
            "Romeo and Juliet",  
            "Don Quixote", 
            "Cinderella ", 
            "La Bayadere", 
            "Coppelia", 
            "The Sleeping Beauty ", 
            "La Sylphide ", 
            "Spartacus", 
            "Alice's Adventures in Wonder Land",
            "Firebird")
```

### `0.3` Create Data Frame

```{r}
ballet_df <- base::data.frame(
  Ballet,
  Composer,
  "First Choreographer" = choreographer_1,
  "Second Choreographer" = choreographer_2,
  Acts,
  month_premiered,
  day_premiered,
  year_premiered)
```

:::

### `1.1 Add date_premiered`

```{r}
ballet_df <- ballet_df %>% 
  mutate(Date.Premiered = make_date(year_premiered,
                                    month_premiered,
                                    day_premiered))
```

```{r}

```

### `1.3 Color Pallete`

```{r}
nb.cols <- 13
mycolors <- colorRampPalette(brewer.pal(7, "Pastel2"))(nb.cols)
```

:::

# `2.` Data Visuals

```{r, echo=F}
# TABLE 
kable(ballet_df) %>%
  column_spec(1:5, background = mycolors) %>%
  row_spec(0:13, align = "c")
```


```{r, echo = F}
# date premiered 
plot <- ballet_df %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x= Date.Premiered, y = Ballet, color = factor(Acts))) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Date Premiered", y = "Ballet", color = "Number of Acts") +
  ggtitle("Ballets by Date Premiered")
ggplotly(plot)
```
